fields.description:
h3. Summary

Links added in the announcement message section does not render in the new help centre (works in the single portal announcement message)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to new help center portal > Customize
 # Enter text [name|http://example.com/] in the announcement message section

h3. Expected Results

[name|http://example.com/]
h3. Actual Results
{code:java}
[name|http://example.com]
{code}
!HC.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Wiki-markup added in announcement message for the help centre page does not render

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a project with Danish default and indexing language, the queues cannot be loaded due to the queues has a default SLA *Tid til beslutning* (Time to resolution) with a trailing white space. eg: {{resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY "Tid til beslutning " ASC}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the default and indexing language to Danish in the General Configuration 
# Create a Service Desk project
# Access the queues

h3. Expected Results
Queue is loaded
h3. Actual Results
Queue is not loaded and shows an infinite loop

h3.Workaround
Manually edit the queues to remove the trailing white space for the *Tid til beslutning* SLA field. Please contact support to do this.
fields.summary: Creating a project in Danish language causes default queues to not load

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When profile preference is set to use French, the Customer Notification page does not load.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set profile preference to French
# Access the Customer Notification of a project.

h3. Expected Results
Customer Notification page loads.
h3. Actual Results
Customer Notification page does not load.

h3.Workaround
Set profile preference to any other language.
fields.summary: Project customer notification is not accessible when using French language

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Service Desk Portal not accessible after switching from old UI to new UI
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Service Desk Project in old UI
 # Switch to New Jira UI
 # Try to access the portal

h3. Expected Results

Reach the Portal Page successfully
h3. Actual Results

You don't have access to any service desks. If you think this is a mistake, try contacting us another way.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 # Switch back to Old UI, access the portal
 # Switch to new UI again
fields.summary: Service Desk Portal not accessible after switching to New Jira UI

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* User starts typing a Service Desk request summary and is presented with KB articles suggestions
* User clicks on an article to expand it in the pop-up window
* User clicks on a link in the article content taking them to another article that is not in the KB space linked to the Service Desk project
* A new browser tab open but the article can't be displayed. Instead, the user gets: 
{panel}
The knowledge base article could not be found.
View other portals
{panel}

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Service Desk users to open links to articles if they're not part of the KB space linked to the Service Desk project. Ideally, these should be handled as regular links and Confluence should manage access to them based on space/page permissions. 
The issue is occurring because the article link is rendered as a Service Desk servlet link: *https://<cloud_url>/plugins/servlet/servicedesk/customer/confluence/shim/spaces/<space_key>/pages/<page_id>/<page_name>* then rewritten to *https://<cloud_url>/servicedesk/customer/kb/view/<page_id>*
and not a direct link to the page: 
*https://<cloud_url>/wiki/spaces/<space_key>/pages/<page_id>/<page_name>*
h3. Workaround
This can be partially resolved by allowing admins to link more than one KB space a Service Desk project => JSDCLOUD-3295
fields.summary: Allow Service Desk users to open pages linked in KB articles that are not in the KB space

fields.description: When creating a linked issues I do not want to choose a resolution as the ticket is not resolved yet.
fields.summary: Create linked Issue demands a resolution when creating the linked issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the "Customer invited" notification can be configured per project. However, the translation is not configurable unlike other customer notifications.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option to configure the translation for Customer Invited notification.
h3. Why this is important
 In a support environment that supports multiple languages, it is important to allow translation for the invitation too like any other customer notification.
fields.summary: Translation for Customer invited notification
User Keep Locked in the JSD Onboarding

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you access any page of a Service Desk Project that have email requests enabled and the *Summary* field is removed from that issue type create screen, a tipbox is displayed with the message:
{quote}This service desk project has configuration problems and may not work as expected.
 * View error details and repair the problem*{quote}
When you click on the link, nothing happens. On the browser console, a stacktrace is displayed. The popup where the problem should be displayed does not show up.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable email requests on a Service Desk project
 # Remove the *Summary* field from the *Create Screen* of the issue type associated with the email channel request type
 # Access any Service Desk project configuration page (eg. Automation page)
 # A tipbox stating that the project has a configuration error is displayed – click on the *view errors details and repair the problem* button

h3. Expected Results

When clicking on the *view errors details and repair the problem button* button a popup should be displayed with the error and the fix.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens on the UI when clicking on the button and this is found on the browser Console tab:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property '1' of null
    at batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:503
    at Function.l [as format] (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:504)
    at d.ServiceDesk.Templates.Shared.Precondition.missingFields [as template] (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:1078)
    at d.render (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:1078)
    at d._createAlertView (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:1078)
    at batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:1078
    at Function.T.each.T.forEach (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:1078)
    at d.s.(anonymous function) [as each] (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:111:491)
    at d.render (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:1078)
    at d.initialize (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:1078)
{noformat}
Using breakpoints it's possible to get the screen name that has problems:

!Screen Shot 2018-08-09 at 11.16.02.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 * Click on the *view errors details and repair the problem* button from the Queue page
 * Access the problematic screen and then add the *Summary* field.
fields.summary: Service desk problems repair tool not working
Ability to Create Incident based on email (currently it's limited to Service Requests only)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Viewing a customer profile leads to {{/people/search}}.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new JSD ticket through the portal on behalf of a new user so a new JSD customer is being created.
# Navigate to the customers overview in JSD
# Click on the customer

h3. Expected Results
Show customer profile

h3. Actual Results
Shows all users in my instance without customers listed
!Screenshot_20180802_110334.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
We use the same link to navigate to a JSD customer in our own app (Atlas CRM) which doesn't work for the same reason.
fields.summary: Viewing a JSD customer profile doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. As Admin:
 # Go to portal
 # Opt-in new help center from customize portal side panel

h3. Repro-1, existing customer forget password flow:
 # As a existing customer
 # Go to portal login page and choose forget password
 # Follow links from the reset password email and reset password
 # Create a request after reset password succeed by click any project

h3. Repro-2, new customer sign-up flow:
 # As admin, enable public signup for servicedesk from Jira Service Desk configuration page "/secure/admin/SDConfiguration.jspa"
 # As customer, go to portal and click sign up
 # Finish sign up by following sign up link from email
 # Create a request by click any project after successfully set password 

Both scenarios will fail with with error message "The security token was missing or invalid. Try refreshing the page", refresh the page can fix the problem.


This is not happening when opt-out portal X
fields.summary: Not able to create ticket after signup or reset password via forget password flow when opt-in portal X

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, to remove the Service Desk customers for the customer's list, you would need to do it from the people page by removing the account from the Service Desk customer's role. 

This only applies if the Service Desk customer is not in any organisations. If the customer is in organisation, you can easily remove the account from the organisations by clicking on 'x' button next to the customer, but this would remove the customer completely from the organisation and not just specifically for the project.

This creates confusion for admins who manage the user via the Service Desk customer's page, and that they have to remove their customers via JIRA users and roles/ people page.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be a lot simpler and efficient to have the Service Desk customer's management, including the removal of account, be done in the Service Desk customer's page. 

People page - For Agents
Customer page - For customer

Perhaps, we can have the 'X' button next to the customer's account on the SD customer page to remove the account.

h3. Why this is important
With the current behavior, if you have a JIRA user who is also a customer, and Service Desk customer's role is given to a group, removing the user from the group or group from the role is not really an effective way. You would have to create a separate group just specifically for the project so you can have a specific group to be assigned as Service Desk customer's role, which not really an ideal solution.
fields.summary: Allow customers to be removed via Service Desk Customer's page instead of the people page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently when a customer/reporter belongs to two organization, the default Share with option is No one.
h3. Suggested Solution

Prompt Users to Select an Organization
fields.summary: Prompt customer to select Organization when they belong to more than one Organization

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Agents are unable to view a customers activity from the ticket anymore


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# View a ticket from the queue
# Hover your mouse over the reporter, on the popup, click on activity
# You are redirected to the customers profile with no activity stream or information

h3. Expected Results
* A list of the customers recent activity is displayed

h3. Actual Results
* Only the users profile is shown, with no recent activity


h3.Workaround
* You can view the customers open and closed tickets from the Customers menu, but it still does not show recent history
fields.summary: Agents are unable to view a customers activity from the ticket anymore

fields.description: Currently Epics cannot be used in Jira Service Desk automation because all the Epic names would be the same.
fields.summary: Add SUMMARY and DATE variables to Epic Summary for automation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customers who have a Custom Portal Logo have noticed that it does not initially appear when a Customer lands directly on the Portal Page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit the Portal Settings for a Service Desk Project and add a Custom Logo
# Visit the Customer Portal for this Service Desk Project

h3. Expected Results
Portal Logo appears 

h3. Actual Results
Portal Logo does not initially load until the user clicks on one of the Request Type Groups:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

No errors in browser console
 
h3. Notes
If the Customer navigates initially from the Help Center to the Service Desk Project, the Portal Logo loads

h3.Workaround
The New Service Desk Portal appears to load the Logs without Issues (https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2018/06/coming-soon-meet-the-new-help-center) 
Engage with Support to enable it.
fields.summary: Portal Logo Does Not Appear on Initial Load

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When logging the time spent in Tempo, it's necessary to reload the page to check if the time tracking information is updated.
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-03 at 15.34.51.png|thumbnail! 
h2. Expected behavior
The time tracking information will be automatically updated after logging the time spent in Tempo.
fields.summary: Time tracking information should be automatically updated after logging hours in Tempo

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When creating a portal-only customer, I can't control if he can or not access KB articles. If the kb is enabled for that project he'll have unrestricted access.

h3. Suggested Solution

I would like to control per user the access of knowledge base. For example, allowing access to some users only.
fields.summary: Knowledge base access restriction for portal-only users

fields.description:
1 I want to manage this list and I want to add my domain @wes.org to the white list.

  So when I resend the invitation it is not going to be blocked.

2 Or when I resend invitation it should unblock that email address.

 

-----------------

 

PSCLOUD-7645 User sarsalan@wes.org not receiving invitation email

Andre Kasper commented:

Hi Srecko,

Thanks for contacting Atlassian Support!

We have analyzed all of the mentioned emails and they were all in our email suppression list.
 The reason they were added to our suppression list was:

550: 550 Invalid Recipient - [https://community.mimecast.com/docs/DOC-1369#550|https://protect-us.mimecast.com/s/NrhYC82gR0hWK82cnOG5f?domain=community.mimecast.com]      

So, what happened is that JIRA tried to send the invite to those addresses and because of the above reason couldn't reach the user mailbox. Our email system maintains a suppression list of recipient email addresses that have recently caused a hard bounce for any customer. 
 If you try to send an email to an address that is on the suppression list, the call to JIRA succeeds, but it treats the email as a hard bounce instead of attempting to send it.

Just to make sure no other user was impacted I have done a bulk search for your domain and it turens out we had more emails at the same state:
 * [ahirani@wes.org|mailto:ahirani@wes.org]
 * [jgrande@wes.org|mailto:jgrande@wes.org]
 * [tstone@wes.org|mailto:tstone@wes.org]
 * [szhang@wes.org|mailto:szhang@wes.org]
 * [ktoich@wes.org|mailto:ktoich@wes.org]
 * [sarsalan@wes.org|mailto:sarsalan@wes.org]
 * [efinnerty@wes.org|mailto:efinnerty@wes.org]
 * [tbarrientos@wes.org|mailto:tbarrientos@wes.org]
 * [mbahamdoun@wes.org|mailto:mbahamdoun@wes.org]
 * [ldursunova@wes.org|mailto:ldursunova@wes.org]
 * [pmazella@wes.org|mailto:pmazella@wes.org]
 * [tdasilva@wes.org|mailto:tdasilva@wes.org]
 * [mfebria@wes.org|mailto:mfebria@wes.org]
 * [herharhaghen@wes.org|mailto:herharhaghen@wes.org]

I've removed the address from the suppression list, but you still need to verify this issue with your Email administrator to make sure in the next attempt we'll be able to reach the mailbox of that user.

Once you have the error resolved just trigger a reset password email for these users.

Best regards,
 *André Kasper*
 Atlassian Cloud Support
fields.summary: Manage

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using custom images for the icon of Request types, the icon height is stretched

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit the icon of a Request type and upload an image

h3. Expected Results

 !_ESD-6__123456_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

 !_ESD-6__123456_no_good_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

The *height: 30px;* in the HTML causes this

h3.Workaround
Remove it from the code
fields.summary: Request type logos are stretched

fields.description:
Summary
CSAT report rounds up all values on the second decimal, which can cause an increased rating

Steps to Reproduce
Have a several CSAT surveys adding up to a value with two decimals (e.g.: 4.925)

Expected Results
Jira should display either as 4.92 or 4.9, as it is closer to reality

Actual Results
Jira displays the value as 5.
fields.summary: CSAT Rating rounds up even on lower end of decimal values

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an email sends to a different project , for example project A with abc@xxx.com email request , however the email subject contain the issue key for a different project , for example B-123 for Project B issue. Then , the email add comment to B-123 instead of creating a new ticket in Project A. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create project A , with email request abc@xxx.com.
# Then, create project B.
# Then , create an issue for issue B with def@xxx.com reporter. The new issue created with B-123 issue key.
# Then, send a new email to abc@xxx.com from def@xxx.com using "B-123 test" subject with "Comment Test" body content.

h3. Expected Results
A new issue created in project A.

h3. Actual Results
"Comment Test" is added as a comment to B-123 issue.

h3.Workaround
Don't use issue key for intended to create a new issue.
fields.summary: Email request processed for a different project

fields.description:
h3. Summary
This seems to be a minor regression of [JRASERVER-42902|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42902]. Copy & paste content from Notepad/Word removes line breaks only on Customer Portal. If we do the same in JIRA view, the line breaks are preserved.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open IE11.
# Access one of the Service Desk issue on Customer Portal.
# Copy & paste the following content to Notepad:
{noformat}
line one
line two
line three
{noformat}
# Then copy & paste the content from Notepad into the comment section of the Service Desk issue.

h3. Expected Results
The content suppose to be:
{noformat}
line one
line two
line three
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
The content will be:
{noformat}
line oneline twoline three
{noformat}

h3. Note
This is also affecting users that open Support tickets on {{https://getsupport.atlassian.com}} on IE11 browser. If you encounter such behaviour, please use the workaround below.

h3.Workaround
# Instead of using Ctrl+V, please use Right-click on mouse - Paste.
# Use a different browser.
fields.summary: Copy and pasting content into a comment in Customer Portal on IE11 removes line breaks

fields.description: The 'Introduction text (optional)' field in Service Desk Portal Settings currently allows a limited number of characters. It would be very useful to increase this limit.
fields.summary: Allow more characters in Service Desk Portal Settings  Introduction text (optional) field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The default project role "Administrators" can have its name changed. If just in case, someone changes the name to "administrators" (with the lower case), Jira Service desk project creation fails and a generic error is thrown in the UI.

*This bug is not happening with Jira core and Jira software projects creation*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to "Project Roles screen"
 # Change the "Administrators" role name to "administrators" (full lower case).
 # Try to create a Jira Service Desk project.

h3. Expected Results

Service desk project is created.
h3. Actual Results

Project creation fails and the following generic message is seen in the UI.

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Change the role name back to "Administrators".
fields.summary: Service Desk project creation fails when "Administrators" project role is changed to "administrators" (lower case)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
SLA timers not stopping if SLA has a condition "Comment: For Customer" when reporter or request participant and commented agent is the same user
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up an SLA that should stopped when a comment: For Customers is added to a customer ticket
 # Create an issue  and add a public comment as the same user

h3. Expected Results

SLA timer should stop when comment is added
h3. Actual Results

SLA timer keeps ticking forever and ever

h3. Workaround
The workaround consists of two elements, an automation rule and the SLA and is as follows:
h4. The Automation Rule

So in this example
 * We took the default automation rule *Comment updates reply status* duplicated this and called it *Comment updates reply status for request participants bug*.
 * Next is the less pretty element of the workaround where we amended the issue match JQL from
{code:java}
 Status = "Waiting for support" AND "Request Type" is not EMPTY {code}
to
{code:java}
 Status = "Waiting for support" AND "Request Type" is not EMPTY AND (assignee = agent1 AND "Request participants" in (agent1)) OR (assignee = agent2 AND "Request participants" in (agent2)) {code}
or
{code:java}
 Status = "Waiting for support" AND "Request Type" is not EMPTY AND assignee in (agent1, agent2) AND "Request participants" in (agent1, agent2) {code}
depending on your requirements.

 * 
 ** The first option would only cover if the assignee and request participant are the same.
 *** This is a little more work to create as you would need repeat this syntax for each of your agents:
{code:java}
(assignee = agent1 AND "Request participants" in (agent1)) OR (assignee = agent2 AND "Request participants" in (agent2)){code}

 * 
 ** The second option has the added benefit of stopping the clock if you have another agent working a ticket alongside the assignee who responds to the customer on their behalf, however this does have the drawback of the agent always acting as an agent when a request participant even if that might not be the intention.
 *** This is also a little less overhead in terms of JQL writing as this requires only one clause for assignee and one for request participants each containing a list of all your agents:
{code:java}
assignee in (agent1, agent2) AND "Request participants" in (agent1, agent2){code}

 * The end result of this automation is that the issue will be transitioned to *Waiting for customer* status when a comment is added by an agent who is a request participant.

Here are two screenshots from my test site of the the Automation rules described above.

Option 1: Only the agent who is assignee stops the clock
 !Screenshot 2019-05-15 at 11.36.29.png|thumbnail!

Option 2: All agents who are request participants stop the clock 
 !Screenshot 2019-05-15 at 12.07.55.png|thumbnail!

*NB*: An unexpected side effect of this rule is that if you remove the option *User is an agent* from the automation rule matching criteria the SLA clock will stop but the issue will not transition. 

h4. The SLA

Here we change added a stop condition to the SLA settings:
 *Entered Status: Waiting for customer*
 So this means that we are now relient on a status change which will be triggered by the above automation to stop this SLA clock. The end result looks like:
 !Screenshot 2019-05-15 at 11.37.57.png|thumbnail! 
 Of course you can add you own goals in here as you see fit.
fields.summary: SLA condition "Comment: For Customer" doesn't stop running SLA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It would be useful to display a list of the reporters existing and previous tickets on the view issue screen.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a panel on the view issue screen that displays all the other existing and previous issues from the reporter that are still open.

h3. Workaround
Move away from the ticket and click on the customer from the Customers menu where you can then view all open and closed issues.
fields.summary: As an agent it would help if you could see all other open from the report on the issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currenty, once a ticket is created via email it is not possible to forward/reply that notification to another project's email address to create a new ticket. (On the same instance)

Example:
# Send email to project01@jira dot com
# Receive notification from project01
# Forward notification to project02@jira dot com to create a new ticket
# Reply is added as a comment to project01 ticket even though a different email address was used

This is due to Jira tracking messages by the Message ID regardless of the TO address used

h3. Suggested Solution
Ignore the message ID if the email is sent to another projects address / there is a different TO address from what is expected for that project

h3. Workaround
Copy the notification into a new email and send that to create a ticket in a new project
fields.summary: Forwarding a notification from an existing project to a new project email should create a new ticket

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently , when customer created from email , customer portal or from invitation , their account will not automatically have Atlassian Account. The admin need to manually migrate them to Atlassian Account.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide option for admin to allow customer automatically have Atlassian Account and without having any application access.

h3. Why this is important
As for instance that have SAML SSO configured , the admin need to manually convert the customer to Atlassian Account in order to use their SSO. 

h3. Workaround 
Manually migrate the customer to Atlassian Account
fields.summary: Ability to set customer automatically have Atlassian Account

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Russian translation missing for 'Create linked issue', and on the screen for 'Create Linked Issue' all the link related fields are still in English


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set your language to Russian
# Click the dropdown ••• menu
# Create Linked Issue is not translated
# Click on Create Linked Issue
# Notice all the linked related field descriptions are still in English

h3. Expected Results
Create Linked Issue is translated to Russian

h3. Actual Results
It is in English when the rest of the menu is in Russian
 

h3.Workaround
No workaround available
fields.summary: Russian translation missing for 'Create linked issue' and other items on the screen

fields.description:
When adding automation rules in a service desk project, tooltips are frozen on screen forever. A Browser refresh is required to clear them.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Add a new automation rule
# Choose a trigger (*issue created* for example)
# Choose a condition (*transition issue* for example)
# Add a condition
# Click on *issue matches* then click on *Advance*
# Start typing JQL *reporter in (* {at this point let choices appear}
# Hover mouse over choices (leave mouse pointer there for the tooltip to appear)
# Type in any name, shortlist it and click on it, or press space bar. 

At this stage, the tooltip is frozen on the screen.

h3. Expected behavior
Tooltip disappears when the mouse pointer is moved after selection of choice

h3. Actual behavior
The tooltip is frozen and stays there until the browser is refreshed.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Tooltips freezing on screen in automation rule

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The new service desk help center has a limit of 1200 characters for the description field while the old version of the portal did not imply such a constraint.

h3. Suggested Solution

Either remove the character limit as it works in the old portal or give the administrators the option to change the character limit for the description field.
fields.summary: Increase character limit for the description field at the new Help Center

fields.description:
Request type is always _No match_ if the issue type has changed by moving the ticket 
h3. Suggested solution

Automatically update the request type corresponding to its issue type
h3. Workaround

If the Move operation involves status changing, you can use the workaround below:
 # The Request type _Heartware problem_ is associated with the Issue type _Problem_.
!reqType.png|thumbnail!
 # Create an automation rule like the one below and include all existing request types and issue types. Whenever the status of any issue changed, if the issue type is not matching with the request type, set it accordingly.
!rule.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Update Request Type automatically when issue type is moved

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Agent/customer unable to view the attachment file when opening it. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue.
# Upload an image 
# Then , try to view the uploaded image


h3. Expected Results
Able to view the image.

h3. Actual Results
Blank image 
 !screen.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: User unable to view the uploaded attachment

fields.description:
By default, when a client submits a ticket through email, do not share the ticket with the organization. Or at least let administrators configure that.

Additionally, when submitting tickets through the portal, the selection should default to "Private" for the client, giving them the power to share the ticket less-accidentally.

Use case: It is very undesirable for an employee exit ticket to be submitted and the entire company notified. Looks bad for the product during its trial-run.
fields.summary: Tickets submitted through email should not by default be shared with the organization

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using Internet Explorer 11, the watcher list is not showing from the issue.

h3. Environment
* Jira Service Desk
* IE 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any JSD project > Queue
# Open any issue from Queue
# Click on the number on the Watcher field to view Watcher list

h3. Expected Results
The list of watchers is showing.
!screenshot.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
A spinning wheel shows, then nothing happens.

h3. Notes
* Open the issue to a new tab, then the watcher list is working fine.
** Watcher list does not work on https://example.atlassian.net/projects/SD/queues/custom/9/SD-1
** Watcher list works on https://example.atlassian.net/browse/SD-1
* Other browsers like Chrome and Microsoft Edge are working fine

h3.Workaround
* Open the issue in a new tab
* Use a different browser
fields.summary: IE 11 - Watcher List is Not Showing when Accessing from Queue

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Email requests with attachments sent to a Jira Service Desk project's incoming email or customized incoming email may fail with "There was an error reading the body of email message" caused by serialization of attachments when uploading the email to the database, making them corrupted.
h2. How to reproduce

The issue is not consistent, so it can't be reproduced simply by sending an email request with attachments, on the other hand, if you send an email with an already corrupted attachment, the behaviour will be the same.
h2. Workaround

If you are using IMAP as the protocol, you can mark the failed email as unread so Jira Service Desk will reprocess it, the risk of failure still exists, though.
fields.summary: Email requests failing with "There was an error reading the body of email message" caused by serialization of attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a knowledge base article is open inside service desk, if this article has a link pointing to a page on a different Confluence space, the page won't open.
h3. Environment
 * Jira servide desk cloud;
 * Confluence cloud;

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project on JSD;
 # Create a page on the related Confluence space;
 # On that new page, insert a link pointing to another page from a different space;
 # Search and access this article from JSD and click on the link.

h3. Expected Results

The page linked should be shown.
h3. Actual Results

An error informing the article was not found is shown:
|!article_not_found.png|thumbnail!|
h3. Notes
 * A link pointing to a page on the same space will open normally inside JSD.
 * Even if the space is set to public, the same error is shown.

h3. Workaround

When linking a non-KB page in a KB page, strip out the last part of the page URL (i.e. the page name) and replace it with a "?". 
 For example, instead of linking to
 * [https://mycompany.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ATLAS/pages/256280232/My+Page+Name]

link to:
 * [https://mycompany.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ATLAS/pages/256280232/?]
fields.summary: Links inside kb articles leading to another Confluence space won't open

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The new Help Center populates the logo of a portal with the logo of the last portal you have accessed in case the current portal does not have one.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two service desk projects
# Add a custom logo for one of them
# Access the new help center and click on the portal with a logo
# Go back to the main page and access the portal without a logo

h3. Expected Results

The portal options should be loaded without any logo.

h3. Actual Results

The portal loads with the logo of the last accessed portal.
Here's a video showing the behavior:
*  [^Screen Recording 2018-07-25 at 04.09 PM.mov]
fields.summary: Help Center uses the logo of the last portal you accessed in case the current portal does not have one.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users invited as Trusted Users to JSD must complete the onboarding and create a project to access Jira


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Invite user as a Trusted User
# New user clicks on signup email
# New user must complete the onboarding asking how their team works and are forced to create a new project

h3. Expected Results
User goes through the standard onboarding that is shown when projects already exist. What would you like to do? Explore projects, search for issues or import. Or something to that effect.

h3. Actual Results
User is presented with the very first onboarding screen used when Jira is started for the first time and must create a project before being able to access Jira
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
* Invite the user a Basic user and then change to Trusted once they have signed up
fields.summary: Users invited as Trusted Users must complete the onboarding and create a project to access Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Suggested KB articles from the portal are displaying a random snippet of text from the middle of the page


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new KB article using either the 'How To" or "Troubleshooting' template
# Enter some text on the page and save
# Create a ticket from the portal using a label from that article
# Notice the suggested article has pulled page text about 100 characters from the start of the page, so you have a random snippet of text

h3. Expected Results
The Summary is show and then a 'summary' of the description/body starting at the start of the page.

h3. Actual Results
The suggested articles starts displaying text from the description/body about 100 characters into the page
 
h3. Notes
* This may only be affecting new articles, old articles I have don't appear to be exhibiting this behaviour

h3. Workaround
* Use a blank page template, not a "How To" or "Troubleshooting"
fields.summary: Suggested KB articles from the portal are displaying a random snippet of text from the middle of the page as a preview

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the customer is only allowed to view the issue from Customer Portal. It will be better if the can view the issue from JIRA if they been given *Browse Project* permission. This is because as for Anonymous user, they are allow to view it if *Group :Anyone* is given *Browse Project* permission. They allow to view issue anonymously, but not when they login as a customer. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow customer to view the issue from JIRA if they been given *Browse Project* permission.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk Customer is allow to view the issue from JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an existing customer account is added to a new Service Desk project, they do not receive an invite although when adding them to a project, even though the text clearly states *Customers will receive an invitation email. Go to customer notifications to view or customize the invitation email.*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure the customer notification for *Customer invited* is enabled.
# navigate to Project > Customer.
# Click on Add customers, add an existing customer account to the project customer list.

h3. Expected Results
The customer receives an invite.

h3. Actual Results
The customer does not receives an invite.
 
h3. Notes
Jira/Confluence licensed users are also affected when they are added as customers to a new Service Desk project.

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Customer invitation dialog text incorrectly suggests existing customers will receive invitation emails.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing a ticket from the 'Queue' menu and performing a transition whilst adding an internal comment and where the issue security is changed via post funciton to a level the assignee/commenter no longer has browse permissions for, causes the transition screen to hang with a spinning wheel. The transition and comment is actually made. The background also changes to permission denied but the window does not dissapear.

This only occurs when viewing tickets from the queue, with a url similar to: https://<instance>.atlassian.net/projects/<KEY>/queues/custom/205/<TICKET>

When using a direct link like: https://<instance>.atlassian.net/browse/<TICKET>
It works as expected, the background changes to permission denied and the window dissapears after adding the comment and performing the transition.

h3. Environment
Confirmed on Windows and Mac
Chrome, IE 11, Edge

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a post function to set the issue level security to a level the assignee will no longer have access to _after_ the transition is performed and a screen to add an internal comment
# View a ticket using the 'Queues' menu
# Perform the transition that will edit the security level, add an internal comment during transition, notice the windows freezes with a spinning wheel


h3. Expected Results
The transition screen disappears and you are left with a permission denied warning
h3. Actual Results
The transition screen freezes whilst the background updates to a permission denied warning

 h3.Workaround
View the ticket directly instead of from the queues menu and perform the transition then
fields.summary: Transition whilst making an internal comment with a post function to set the security level can cause the transition screen to freeze

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
Currently when [Configuring service desk notifications | https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/configuring-service-desk-notifications-732528936.html]Depending on the chosen *"When"* Trigger event Option Selected Different *Choose recipients* options become available for the To option when sending an email, BUT there is no mention of which is available under each option only noting:
{quote}
Choose recipients
Add at least one of the following to the To field:

|| Recipient options | Details ||
| Reporter (customer) | The reporter of the request. This notification is sent even if the reporter has opted out of receiving notifications on the customer portal. |
| Customers involved | All customers involved on the request, including the reporter and request participants. This notification is not sent to customers if they have turned off notifications for an individual request in the portal or a request's email thread. |
| Added participants | The people who have been added as request participants.
Added organizations The people in an organization that the request has been shared with. |
| Approvers | The people who need to approve or decline a request. |
| Exclude person who caused the action | Prevents the person who triggered the rule from receiving a notification. For example, if a customer adds a comment to a request, you can choose to exclude them so they don't receive a notification about their own comment.|
{quote}

As an EXE:
If you Choose: "WHEN=Status Changed" for the THEN Send Email *"TO"* Field only has the options *"Reporter (Customer)"* & *"Customers Involved"* available

h3. Suggested Solution
Add information to available Choose recipients options per Trigger event
 
h3.Current Options:
|| Trigger | Available Recipient options ||
| A Linked Issue is Transitioned | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |
| Approval Complete | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |
| Approval Required | Reporter (customer), Approvers, Customers Involved |
| Comment Added | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |
| Comment Edited | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |
| Issue Created | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |
| Issue Resolution Changed | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |
| Organization added to issue | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved, Added Organizations |
| Participant Added to Issue | Reporter (customer), Added Participant, Customers Involved |
| SLA Time Remaining | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |
| Status Changed | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |
| Time In Status | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |

h3. Additional Note:

(!) There is also a limitation for the recipients to which an email can be sent by the "Send Email" action in the automation rules. We should specify it in the documentation [Automating your Service Desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/automating-your-service-desk-732528900.html]

 !Automation_SendEmailRule.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Provide Clarification on available Choose recipients options

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently , customer is not possible to added comment in knowledge base page from Customer Portal.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide feature for customer to comment knowledge base.
fields.summary: Allow customer to add comment in Knowledge Base

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

Currently when you create a customer you can only create a username and save the customer's email address details. The organization option only allows to categorize the customer but not much other detail can be added.

*Suggested Solution*

It would be great to be able to add much more details to the customer profile such as roles, positions, organization links and other attributes that can be populated to identify the customer easily, blending with the company's workflow. In addition, with the ability to sync via Active Directory, it would be great if the existing customer details can be displayed within the instance to ensure faster migration and data configuration.
fields.summary: Ability to Create Customer Profiles With Company Details

fields.description:
For context, I work with a couple of different projects that like to have their issue trackers public. Foremost this is to give their users more direct insight into what features are up for consideration, bounce ideas off of each other, and see their current statuses. Additionally, being generally smaller teams makes directly having "support reps" responding to all requests, managing duplicates, etc unfeasible or just overkill.

For a public issue tracker, Jira Software/Jira Core is out of reach due to the fact that licenses are per-user no matter the users' role. I've seen Jira Service Desk as an alternative to this, so that payment is only made for agents, and there is still the option of linking back to Jira Software/Core. That said, currently the only method to access the requests screen is by clicking your username, and then clicking "all". This is very unintuitive, so for this use case it is still a bit of a stretch.

It would be great to have the option of putting the request list on the project customer portal, with a "create request" link sending the user to what is now the portal page, or at least on the current portal page having a link to "browse all issues". Additionally, having public request lists that don't require a user to be in an organization as well as integrating a search functionality into the issue reporting workflow (common in other community management suites) would help streamline this use case.
fields.summary: More direct interface to request list

fields.description:
Currently in Jira, when there is a comment with an attachment added to it and it is sent out to the reporters of the ticket, they need to be logged in so they can view the attachment. 

 

We have many customers that cannot log into Jira due to organization restrictions. Viewing these attachments via email is what we would like to see.
fields.summary: Add the ability to attach files to comments so non-logged in recipients can view them

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there's no option to disable the Google reCAPTCHA for customers log in.

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement an option that would allow the project admins to chose whether they want their service desk to have reCAPTCHA enabled to prevent possible spams or disabled to facilitate the customer's logins.
fields.summary: Provide option to disable reCAPTCHA for service desk

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you send an email message to JIRA Service Desk with an email address that contains special characters on the local-part, it is rejected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an email address on a provider that allows special characters on the local-part on the email address
# Send a message to JIRA Service Desk mail handler

h3. Expected Results
Message is accepted and processed accordingly

h3. Actual Results
Message is rejected with the error:
{noformat}
email : You must specify a valid email address.	
{noformat}
fields.summary: Mail Handler don't accept special characters on local-part of email address

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

When the feature request JSDCLOUD-5651 was implemented, the ability to choose if the customer will receive an invite notification on the "Add customer" on the customer's page was removed.

h3. Suggested resolution

Add the "Send portal invitation" checkbox back to the customer's page.
 !image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Keep the feature "Send portal invitation" checkbox on customer's page

fields.description:
Dear Jira Support,

I would like to mention requested participants in a comment with the "@"-function (so that they receive a mail that tells them they have been mentioned). At the moment, it seems to be only possible to mention other agents and the author of the request with this function. 

I want to suggest to add this possibility to the Service Desk.

Thanks for your help!

Best wishes

p. p. Konstantinos Tsilimekis
fields.summary: Mentioning requested participants in a comment using @

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Portal users can be granted a non-portal role in the project's People configuration. 



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a user as a customer in a service desk project.
# Go *Project Settings > People*
# Grant the *Administrator* role to the same user.

h3. Expected Results

It should not be possible to grant a non-portal role to portal users as those roles are reserved for licensed users. 

h3. Actual Results

Non-portal role can be granted.

!portal only.png|thumbnail!  

!People.png|thumbnail! 

!list.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

Granting the non-portal role on the People page does not have any effect as portal users are unlicensed and does not have access to the project.
fields.summary: Portal users can be granted a non-portal role in People settings

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When uploading custom request type icon, it is displayed correctly on some parts bug in the new portal, it is stretched on *Recently used portals* and when viewing the issue on JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload a custom request type icon
# View the issue inside JIRA and look in the request type

h3. Expected Results

The icon should be correctly displayed everywhere and not just on some sections.

h3. Actual Results
The icon is stretched. It doesn't matter the size used when uploading the image
fields.summary: Request type icon size getting stretched

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to update the "Front page title" on the global portal, the text doesn't reflect the changes.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

+Prerequisite:+
 * Profile Language is set to "Automatically detect browser setting"
 * Browser language has set "English" as the top option
 !screenshot1.png|thumbnail!

 # Go to *JIRA Settings > Applications > JIRA Service Desk > Configuration*
 # Click on *View and customize* your Help Center, as well as change your Help Center announcement.
 # Attempt to update "Front page title"
 # *Save changes*

h3. Expected Results

"Front page title" is updated to the latest text.
h3. Actual Results

No changes on "Front page title"
h3. Notes
 * Replicated on Chrome and Firefox
 * Not happening on all users

h3. Workaround
 * Option 1: Update Profile Language to other than "Automatically detect browser setting"
 * Option 2: Update the browser language to English (US) or English (UK)
For Chrome, need to check the "Display Google Chrome in this language" option after moving the language to the top.
 !screenshot2.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Global HelpDesk - "Front page title" is Not Updated

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Now under the "Open Requests" column the "View Open" has a pre-set JQL format which is evident in the URL. This what I'd like to be able to change, as a workaround I've created a filter which performs the JQL that I'd like.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create the ability to change the JQL filter that is used in the "View Open" on the customer's list.
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-17 at 12.05.53.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to change the JQL of "View Open" on customer's list

fields.description:
Entering the Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) URL with an invalid {{rating}} causes the page to fail.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Give a star rating to a customer satisfaction email, and then change the URL to something invalid
 !image-2018-07-17-15-00-56-075.png!

h3. Expected Result
 * Some kind of error message about the expected rating range
(e.g. from Server:    !image-2018-07-17-15-01-26-914.png! )
 

h3. Actual Result
 * Spinner spins forever and page fails to load.
fields.summary: Customer Satisfaction survey page hangs if given invalid rating

fields.description: This feature request has been created in order to get feedback on the new JSD portal redesign for the help center and request create pages.
fields.summary: Feedback on the new JSD Portal design for the help center and request create pages

fields.description:
For instance, it would be extremely helpful if we could configure a project to have a "Closed" portal so that only certain users can see it but have an "Open" email channel so that anyone can email a request. 

Presently, both must be Closed or both must be Open. If Closed, then emails from new users at our partners who we have not added to the project will not get processed. If Open, then anyone can create an account and see all of the content on the portal. This is a particular problem for us because we have many customers that we have factored into separate JSD projects and we require that a customer only be able to see their own portal. So we face the choice of either potentially missing important requests or of exposing customer names and portals/portal content to the public or to our other customers.

With this suggestion, we could keep the portals closed so that each user at a customer only sees their own (once we have granted them the permission), but still allow for anyone to email the address for their project (even if we are not yet familiar with the sending user).
fields.summary: Separate access control for the portal vs email submission

fields.description:
Currently, there is a [REST API call to create Customers (Service Desk)|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-customer-post] but this operation does not cause invitation email to be sent to the newly created customer.

The suggestion is to add the possibility to decide if the email can be sent or to implement another REST API with this function.
fields.summary: Add a REST API for Customer creation with invitation email

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

As of now to enable JIRA to create comments and issues from email, you need to first configure JIRA to receive email from a POP or IMAP mail server. Currently SMTP/SMTPS connectivity options are not supported and thus only generic commercial options are made available for usage. For customers dealing with government organizations, secured connections are of top priority and the existing connections do not cater for the customers needs. 

With the existing options given, the customer is required to open ports to allow connectivity from Jira Cloud to mail server despite having an already secured system configured. 

*Suggested Solution* 

The ability to have SMTP/SMTPS option for Jira Cloud to retrieve information for customers allows more custom-tailored experience and more control the secured connection that being allowed to the mail servers.
fields.summary: Support SMTP and SMTPS Connectivity in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Inactive users currently are not allowed to create issues via email on a public portal. This is currently used to allow admins to block users from abusing the portal (ie. spamming). This can be contradicting to the public nature of the portal

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow a toggle for admins to enable or disable this feature and implement an email blacklist functionality as mentioned on JSDCLOUD-3836.

h3. Why this is important
 
Admins want the flexibility to keep inactive users according to their user management process.
fields.summary: Allow inactive users to create issues via email on a public portal

fields.description: Ability to choose how many _select lists_ are included in the _select list (cascading)_ custom field.
fields.summary: More than two options for cascading select lists

fields.description:
When creating a new Service Desk project in Jira Cloud it is possible to create an associated knowledge base space in Confluence. 

Currently an "overview" page is created. A user would like to choose a custom Confluence page template from the Jira menu to associate with the new Service Desk projects.

Screen shot from Jira - either option "Create article" or "Go to Confluence" will result in the overview page being created in Confluence:

 

!Screen Shot 2018-07-12 at 12.13.40 PM.png|width=411,height=275!

The resulting page in Confluence:

!Screen Shot 2018-07-12 at 12.15.21 PM.png|width=366,height=244!
fields.summary: As a user I would like to choose my Jira Service Desk project overview knowledge base template

fields.description:
As a site-admin, I'd like to have administrative control of the reCAPTCHA displayed to customers when having a login-free portal.

Currently, it is to complex and sometimes users needs more than one try, taking time to submit requests.
fields.summary: Provide control about Captcha complexity

fields.description:
h3. Summary

- Broke avatar shows hash code as fallback and overlap issue information.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue on Jira interface
# Inspect the reporter's avatar (must be a customer) 
# Breaks the href attributes

h3. Expected Results

- It shows a broken image only.

h3. Actual Results

- It breaks the image and shows the customer's hash overlapping information on the ticket (please check the attachment).
fields.summary: Broke avatar shows hash code as fallback and overlap issue information

fields.description:
As a site-admin, I'd like to have administrative control of the reCAPTCHA displayed to customers when having a login-free portal. 

Would like a choice for the complexity of the CAPTCHA. Currently, it is to complex and sometimes customer needs more than one try to fulfill it.
fields.summary: Provide control about Captcha complexity

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Custom email request suddenly is not working. User notice it by, from their email inbox, the email is already marked as Read, but from the email request processing log, all the email is not processed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Can't reproduce, but it only happens for custom email request.
h3. Expected Results

All email that is processed will display in the processing log and it worked well.
h3. Actual Results

h3. Notes
It appears to be happening only when the custom email is using IMAP. POP does not show the same error.

The email is not creating any ticket or update as a comment. There are no logs showing in the processing log.
h3. Workaround

One of the reason when such issue have been reported were cases where there was a second process reading e-mails from the mailbox that Jira Servicedesk was trying to read.  The second process would move some e-mails or mark them as read before Jira Servicedesk had a chance to read them.

A possible workaround would be to forward e-mails to your project's default e-mail address.

Please contact support for further help troubleshooting your issue.
fields.summary: Some incoming e-mails from custom mailbox are not processed into requests

fields.description: Currently the Add customer only lets you add the customer email address and organization. We would like to add the customer phone number to the profile information as the customer can be contacted when the ticket comes in.
fields.summary: Add a custom field to Customer profile and Organization

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

As of now, you can only link one *space* to your Jira Service Desk, this means all your knowledge base articles have to be created within that space to be shared with the customers, when you are supporting customers from all over the world, with customers from different countries, language support is very important.

It is possible to customize the portal based on the customer's preference but when it comes to knowledge base. It is not possible, to only have customer language specific knowledge base to be shown when the customer searches via the portal, all the language knowledge base can be viewed by the customer.

*Suggested Solution*

Have JIRA Service Desk be able to ensure that each knowledge base language article can only be viewed by the respective customer that is supported by that language. For example, Dutch customers, when searching the portal for knowledge base only can view Dutch translated knowledge base articles, they will not be able to view the same knowledge base in English language in the same space.

This will be a label based system or the same way how the browser is able to detect the browser language and affect the customer portal language, the knowledge base should follow in suit to that specified language only.
fields.summary: Ability to cater Knowledge Base Search Based on Customer's Language

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As admin, I can choose different language on Portal -> Customize -> Select a language to customize translations
But this is not changing my Portal language and it still remain on English

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As admin, go to the Portal
# Click, Customize and choose different language in "Select a language to customize translations"
# Press Save button

h3. Expected Results
Portal is translated to a different language

h3. Actual Results
Portal is remained in English

h3.Workaround
In order to have Portal in different than English (default language) more than action require.
# As admin, go to Project Settings -> Language support. Add another language (Slovak, for example), verify/add translations.
# Decide if Slovak will be the default language for all customers
# As customer, go to Portal -> Profile and choose Slovak (or keep default browser language if it is in Slovak)

h4. What exactly "Portal -> Customize -> Select a language to customize translations" does?
As admin, go to Portal -> Customize -> Select a language to customize translations and choose Slovak.
Fill up provided fields (announcement, Help Centre title etc) if you want them to be different depends on the language.
fields.summary: "Customize translation" on the portal is not translating the portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Opening Customers' profile using the new Jira UI it's not possible.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using the new Jira experience, go to customers' page.
 # Click on a customer's name.

h3. Expected Results

It opens directly the customer's profile.
h3. Actual Results

It opens the people search page and shows 404 on developer tool:
{code:java}
36646c1071579a0b67b391350ae5e18a:1 GET https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/36646c1071579a0b67b391350ae5e18a?r=g&d=404&s=128 404 () {code}
fields.summary: Opening Customers' profile using the new Jira UI it's not possible.

fields.description:
h3.*Summary*

When you send an email to JIRA Service Desk mail handler and the user does not have permission to share the ticket(add participants) it would be nice to have the ability to see the users which were CC on the email.

h3.*Actual Results*
* JIRA discards the values

h3.*Expected Results*
* Have the ability to see the header values of the email
fields.summary: Add the ability to see users which were added as CC

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It would be good to be able to view SLA information for the sub-tasks displayed on the parent ticket.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option to display a chosen SLA for sub-tasks to be displayed on the parent issue.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: View SLA information for sub-tasks from the parent issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
For instance that using Russian language , the "Request Participant", "Approvers" and "Organization" fields are not translated in issue view.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set profile language to Russian
# Open any JIRA Service Desk ticket.

h3. Expected Results
"Request Participant" and "Organization" field translated to Russian
h3. Actual Results
"Request Participant" and "Organization" field is not translated to Russian
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-08 at 5.25.03 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Organization", "Approvers" and "Request Participant" are not translated to Russian

fields.description: Jira Service Desk also has an email verification step for portals where anonymous portal isn't enabled. This email cannot be currently customised.
fields.summary: Customise the email verification step for portals where anonymous portal isn't enabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary Custom Email notifications do not display description value in the same line as in the preview h3. Steps to reproduce # Go to any Service Desk Project settings > Customer notifications # Click on 'Edit templates' button and use below HTML format for the customer notifications. {noformat}
Reply above this line.

Request NO: ${issue.key}
Reported By: ${issue.reporter.name}
Description: ${issue.description}
${message.content}

Thank you

{noformat} # Notice that the description value is being displayed in the same line in the preview. !Template.png|thumbnail! # Save the template changes. # Go to any ticket and make a comment as an agent and share it with the customer. # Check the actual email notification in the customer inbox. The description value is displayed in the new line. h3. Expected Results The description value should display in the same line as that of in the preview. h3. Actual Results The description value is displayed in the new line. !Email.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Custom Email notifications do not display description value in the same line as in the preview

fields.description: I would like to add a queue refresh timer to the Queues page.  I know that when new issues come in, they show up automagically, but I would like to be able to see updates in the workflows in real time
fields.summary: Queue Refresh

fields.description:
When you link a JIRA Service Desk project to a Confluence space, you need to choose between two viewing permissions.

# All active users and customers can access the knowledge base without a confluence license
# Only licensed users who have access to the space.

 !Screen Shot 2018-07-06 at 15.24.26.png|thumbnail! 

As it is designed now, you must let all active users access the space in order to let customers access the space.

We should have an option where customers would have access to the space and regular users would have access according to the space permissions.

User case: You don't want regular JIRA/Confluence users access a space that should be restricted to customers.
fields.summary: Impossible to set up a Knowledge base restricted to customers without grant access to all active JIRA/Confluence users.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When in JIRA Service Desk already created an SLA name with *&* character , in future , when the admin try add the same SLA name at other project from the drop down list , it will have *amp;* word.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a JIRA Service Desk project A
# Create an SLA name called *Response A&B*
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-06 at 5.19.55 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Then , open a JIRA Service Desk project B
# Create a new SLA metric
# Click on the drop down list to choose the existing SLA name :-
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-06 at 5.21.24 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Click the *Response A&B*

h3. Expected Results
The same *Response A&B* name display.

h3. Actual Results
The SLA name display as {noformat}Response A&B{noformat}
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-06 at 5.21.35 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
Type in the correct name.
fields.summary: Special character "&" is not display correctly in SLA name after choosing it from the drop down list

fields.description: Will it be possible in the future to restrict access to Issue types by group?  This would come very handy as I have a lot of issue types and I don't need everyone to see all of them they should only see the ones that apply to their department.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict access to Issue Types

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently , the result of the search bar is depending on the text inserted. Some admin would like to show a default response, an additional to the result from the text searched.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide option to set a default result for any text searched.
fields.summary: Ability to set default result in Customer Portal Search bar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's only option to set project default using a username and user who trigger the rule. There's certain automation only can set the project default , for example for SLA trigger. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Option to set Assignee as the project default.

h3. Why this is important
It's a bit weird if customer notice a different person than the assignee that perform action in the ticket.
fields.summary: Ability to set "Run as Assignee" as the default automation executor

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Because of GDPR, user CSV export now does not include the username anymore for portal-only Jira Service Desk users but include the QM code.

h3. Suggested Solution
 Replace the QM code by a GDPR-compliant information that would be more useful and user readable.
fields.summary: Include the email address instead of the QM code for JSD customers on the CSV export

fields.description:
Hi,

Queues pages don't present any data and keeps in eternal loading,

Verifying browser details I get the following error:

https:/[url]/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/HEL/issuelist?jql=assignee is EMPTY AND resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY "Time to resolution" ASC&columnNames=customfield_11124&columnNames=issuetype&columnNames=issuekey&columnNames=priority&columnNames=status&columnNames=summary&columnNames=components&columnNames=created&columnNames=reporter&startIndex=0&issuesPerPage=50

 
|errors|[…]|
|0|{…}|
|errorMessage|A search exception occurred|
|reasonKey|sd.issue.search.exception|
|reasonCode|500|

 

Can you provide some help ?

 

Adicionaly i can't submit any bug reports, so sorry if it is in the wrong page.

 

Best Regards

Bruno Mação
fields.summary: Eternal loading in Queues Page

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian,

It would be nice if Service Desk could automatically add users to an organisation if the domain provided in their email address matches one that is on a list inside the Organisation.

eg, inside Acme Co. I can specify that all users that have the domain name @acme.com will automatically be added to the Acme Co. organisation inside Service Desk.
fields.summary: Automatically add new users to organisations

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian,

Currently, there is an endpoint provided by the API to get a list of customers registered on Service Desk. It does have a field ('query') that allows you to search for users based on their display name *_or_* email address.

[https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-servicedesk-serviceDeskId-customer-get]

I am writing an integration for Jira, and I was wondering if it would be possible to filter not on all fields, but rather _just_ the email address.

Currently, the process is to make a request to /rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/\{serviceDeskId}/customer and loop through all the results and double check that any users that are returned actually have the email address set on the field to ensure that we are adding users to organisations correctly.

eg, I have an organisation, ACME Co. Emails from their organisation come from @acme.com. I want to do a few requests to find all users that have an account @acme.com (I have a list of email addresses, so this isn't a huge problem...)

When I do a search for tim@acme.com, it will return the user that has that email address, but it will _also_ return a user that has the display name [tim@acme.com.|mailto:tim@acme.com.]

This behaviour does not seem valid.
fields.summary: Allow searching for service desk users by email address

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customers are not receiving notification email for comment added from automation
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Service Desk project from the Sample data.
 # Create an Automation Rule to run as project default and enable the rule.
 ## WHEN: Comment is added
 ## IF: Issue matches: Status = "Resolved" or "Closed"
 ## THEN: Add Comment
 # Create a Service Desk issue as a customer.
 # Resolve the issue by clicking on the Resolve this issue transition button in JIRA.
 # Insert a comment from the customer portal.

h3. Expected Results

Comment is added to the ticket and customer is notified via email
h3. Actual Results

Comment is added to the ticket however, the customer is not notified via email
fields.summary: Customers are not receiving notification email for comment added from automation

fields.description:
While anonymous users are able to submit Service Desk requests without a dedicated account, all customers are required to include an email address when submitting a ticket into a Service Desk.

It would be helpful to allow for customers to be able to submit tickets without an email address, in case those users don't have one in the first place.
fields.summary: Allow for customers to submit Service Desk requests without an email address

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using Portugese and creating a report filtered on Organisation in *basic* search mode creates an error, "please switch to *basic* mode" which they already are in causing confusion. In English using *basic* search the error advises to switch to *advanced* mode as expected.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Switch profile language to Portugese (portugese)
# Create JSD report
# Using basic search mode dropdown filter on "Organization"
# You will receive an error in Portugese advising to switch to basic mode when that is the current search mode

h3. Expected Results
* When in *basic mode* and filtering on *Organization* an error in Portugese should inform the user to switch to *advanced mode* to filter by *Organization*. 
* Correct message in Portuguese: "Para buscar por Organizations mude para busca avançada, por favor."

h3. Actual Results
* When in *basic mode* and filtering on *Organization* an error in Portugese is displayed "Please switch to basic mode" to filter by Organization
 
h3. Notes
* Switching JSD Language Support default languages, Jira default language or any combo had no effect. Just the user's profile in Portugese was enough to cause these symptoms.

h3.Workaround
Switch to *Advanced Mode* JQL and ignore the error
fields.summary: Creating a report in Portugese filtered by Organization fails with a conflicting error

fields.description:
The current document on our site of https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-jira-service-desk/explore-a-sample-project-917968337.html is inaccurate for Jira Cloud today.

The steps in that doc cannot be followed in current Jira Cloud versions.  It stands that https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67625 documents this limitation.   In the meantime we should likely pull this page to avoid customer confusion/frustration over this inability.
fields.summary: Creating a project with sample data documentation inaccurate in current cloud versions
Unable to add Request Participants using their email address via REST API

fields.description:
At this moment,  if I click on any page tree macro links, or on a link in a page through the service desk knowledge base, instead of opening the page still on the service desk, it redirects the user to Confluence.

Customers should not be redirected to the instance's Confluence.
fields.summary: Page tree macro links on KB pages should send the user to KB pages

fields.description:
We could really need a way to limit the widget to certain articles.

Confluence articles made for the widget often need different formating to look good, and so on.
fields.summary: Limit to confluence KB-articles based on (widget specific) label/s

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is currently not possible to alter the frequency with which satisfaction surveys are sent out. Currently, they are sent every time an issue is resolved.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would great if you would add a limiter to satisfaction surveys. For an internal company, it is overkill to send after every ticket and I've found that they just begin to ignore them. 

Being able to limit to x% of total tickets, or specific % per user (only receive survey on every 3rd ticket, etc.) would be beneficial.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Limit frequency of satisfaction surveys

fields.description: The service desk widget currently shows unparsed markup (such as external links) used in a request-type descriptions.
fields.summary: Service desk widget should probably not show unparsed markup

fields.description:
Ideally, our clients would like to be able to save/export issues search results as a TXT or CSV file with the currently viewed columns.  

Is there a way to do this, without any add on  ?
Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Export search results to csv

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When there are multiple required approvers added in a transition, Issue History and Activity is not updated until all approvers have approved the transition. It would be useful to have a history item set for each of the approves, so that the users would know when each approver has approved the issue for auditing purposes


h3. Suggested Solution
JSD should log each approvers action as a system event, and log a history event for each action applied by the individual approver, So that when the approval action is completed per user a timestamp is included for review and audit.
fields.summary: History should be set when each approver approves a transition
